result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward D Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
OWI 6th.

Conditions:

Serve 1 year in the Richland County Jail, however, 6 months of that sentence is withheld, conditioned upon Defendant's application and admission into the Richland County Alcohol Treatment Court once it is up and running.  Jail is with work release.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming or education ordered by the agent.  Obey rules of the agent.  Comply with any alcohol screenings required.
JOC AMENDED 10/18/19 per request of the Defendant, without objection from the DA, and by Order of the Court: DL revocation length changed from 3 years to 2 years.
Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

timeConds.notes:
As described in the conditions summary.  AMENDMENT following sentencing 10/3/16:  This conditional jail time is to be served CONSECUTIVELY to the jail time in 16CF73.
Consecutive to: 16CF73

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edward D Ford in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  16CF31, 16CF73, 16CF74/adjourned initials; 16TR165 and 166/status.

Counsel inform the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution.

Def waives his right to prelim in 16CF31 and 16CF73.  Court's colloquy re prelim waivers.  

Def pleads guilty to count 1/OWI 6th in 16CF31 and count 1/felony bail jumping in 16CF73.  Discussion re treatment court options; def may be the first person available for the program.  

Court adopts the parties' recommendation and will stay part of the probation contingent upon def's acceptance to treatment court.

Sentence:  16CF73 - 4 months jail with good time and huber.  Costs remitted entirely in that case.  0 days credit.

Sentence:  16CF31 - withheld for 3 years probation - conditions:  serve 1 year in the county jail however 6 months of that sentence is withheld conditioned upon def's admittance into the Richland County Alcohol Treatment Court once it is up and running.  Work release.  Attend, pay for, and complete any counseling ordered by agent.  Obey rules of agent.  Comply with any alcohol screenings as required.  $600 plus costs.  Blood draw reimbursement, $69 Richland County.  3 years revocation.  3 years IID upon relicensing.  Submit driver safety plan and AODA to be relicensed.  Parties stipulate to 5 days credit on this case.

TR cases dismissed.  16CF74 also dismissed/read-in.

(CLARIFICATION AFTER SENTENCING:  Court states that the conditional jail sentence in 16CF31 is to be consecutive to the jail sentence in 16CF73.)
Adjourned initial appearance on October 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

M asks for early October.  Court sets 10/3 at 1:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
